item.description:
This Event is FULL  RSVPs Closed

Please read the entire Write Up and agree to the enclosed Liability Waiver before signing up for this event.

Rating: Moderate

Distance: 4 Miles

Time Duration: 2 Hours

Orange: Recommended

Fisherville Brook Wildlife Refuge in Exeter contains 937 acres of fields, diverse forest habitats, pond, streams (including a lovely waterfall), and a historic cemetery. There are several bridges to cross and even a historic cemetery that dates back to the 1700s, set against a backdrop of fields filled with wildflowers.

The Southern section features a 2.4 miles loop trip and should take about 1 hour to complete. The Trail across Pardon Joslin Rd through the Parking Area where we will hike the Northern section with about 1.5 miles of trial which should take less than 1 hour to complete.

See the link to the refuge below:

http://www.asri.org/refuges/fisherville-brook-wildlife-refuge.html

Good footwear is required and please bring water and insect repellent.

Directions: Take Route 95 South to Route 4 and take Exit 5 to RI 102 West toward Exeter (not Wickford). Follow RI 102 West for 4 Miles and take a Right onto Widow Sweets Road (just past Fire Station and Town Offices). Then turn Right onto Pardon Joslin Rd and about 3/4 Mile down the road you will see an Audubon Society Sign, Parking is on Right.

Note; Do Not take Sunderland Rd which becomes Hopkins Hill Rd to Pardon Joslin Rd. This end of Pardon Joslin Rd might not be open all the way to the refuge. Take Widow Sweets Rd to Pardon Joslin Rd.

Also: you can also get here Via Route 95. Take Exit 5 East off 95 onto RI 102 East (Heading toward Wickford/ North Kingstown). After about 4 miles take a Left onto Widow Sweets Road, just before the Fire Station and Town Offices and follow above instructions to the refuge.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

Safety First!

group.name: Rhode Island Hiking Club " Walks and Rambles "

item.name: Fisherville Brook Refuge Spring Hike
